revised_title: Reflex Times in the South African Clawed Frog: Investigating the Influence of Temperature and Survival Period on Reflexes
tldr: This study investigates the reflex times in the South African clawed frog to determine the delay in transmission of reflex impulses in the spinal cord. The author examines the influence of temperature and the period of survival after operation on reflex times, finding that these factors can significantly affect the length of reflex times. The research provides insights into the neural mechanisms of reflexes in frogs and their response to environmental conditions.
